column4: is there a way to install from the CD and exclude writing over /home ?
re-install i mean..
by far the easiest would be to backup /home then resintall.
yeah.. but I don't have equipment for that :(
if the size of /home makes it prohibitive to upload somewhere or burn it to a cd, you could create a partition and throw it on there, then reinstall, move /home back, and get rid of the partition.
good idea but I don't have enough space on the hd :(
why do you need to reinstall?
I have made every update available since upgrading to 7.10 but now I'm getting make dep errors every time I try to upgrade and it's all a mess
ah
how brave are you? ;)  You could boot into the livecd, mount the drive, delete everything but the /home directory and then do the partition thing and reinstall.
what do you mean with the partition thing? do you mean manually create them in fdisk?
well you could use gparted on the livecd. that would be far easier.
let me see I got this right.. I should boot the install cd.. mount my harddrive rm everything but /home.. then start gparted.. what do I do from here and what is the command for reinstall?
correct so far. then you would resize the partition that your /home is on just enough so you can fit /home onto another partition.
then you create that partition and copy /home over to it
then you run the installer as normal from the desktop and have it install onto the first partition.
what the heck.. I'll just buy an external harddrive I need the space anyways 500gb for ~$100 not bad. :)
haha that would be much simpler! I never said this was an optimal solution ;)
do you know if external hds with USB 2.0 is a piece of cake with ubuntu?
should be plug and play.
alright.. thanks!
